question: An earth satellite S has an orbit radius which is 2 times that of a communication satellite C. What will be the period of revolution of S?
explanation: As per Kepler's third law, the square of the period of any planet is proportional to the cube of the semimajor axis of its orbit. T<sub>s</sub>/T<sub>c</sub> = 2<sup>3/2</sup>= 4 days
